reviewText:
Ok, I think I've played this game long enough to warrant a fair review for it, and before I rip it to shreds I will first talk about the upsides to it:
First off the game is Hella fun, the only F2P TPS that's not only similar to gears, but does it well enough that it doesn't feel like a cheap rip off. Despite it being a very early version of the more updated chinese version, it still has enough modes to keep you comin back to at least complete the daily missions, everything you remember about Gears of War is here and you'll feel right at home if you're a fan. Sadly this game has several downsides that really make it difficult for me to recommend it to anyone, and we'll start with:

1) the revive system - although it's a minor gripe, I still hate the fact that even if you're in the middle of reviving someone or getting revived, if they arrive just a tad too late then you will die because the bleedout timer does not stop as you are reviving someone/being revived, and because of the high numbers of enemies on screen in this game, you WILL die a lot, luckily this is counter balanced with how many lives you can earn a day, which brings me to my next point...

2) the weapon unlock system - (the word system is censored in this game for some unknown reason btw...), sadly this one's a big minus for me, this game has a rental system which I really despise in games, and the only reason I gave it a chance was because you can pick up weapons in the field and try out new guns that way, however it's honestly not enough to save it, and this is why... there is a total of 21 Basic weapons you can unlock permanently for free with in game currency at the moment (they may or may not have added more gold coin guns to unlock as of this), and like 3/4s of the rest of the arsenal can only be unlocked with EMP (premium currency) or by gambling your life away with bullets (Silver for common and uncommon items, Gold for uncommon and rare, and Platinum for Unique and legendary items...), sadly like any RNG based game, it's set to give you the least chance possible to get stuff for free and 75% of the time you either get lives or temporary equipment (which blows), this honestly kills any sense of achievement and is only there as an excuse to say that this game is fair because it gives everyone equal chance to obtain stuff for free, but let's face it, the RNG is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t~!!! There seriously needs to be better free to unlock guns like in Planetside 2 or Blacklight Retribution, to at least make the player feel more rewarded for working for perm guns instead of gambling away in hopes that with some Dumb Luck he can get the stuff he wanted to get for 10,000 years... This next point saddens me the most...

3) the game heavily caters to whales and compulsive gamblers - though this game isn't very Pay 2 Win, I can definetly say with confidence that it's heavily Pay 2 Advantage which isn't much different really if you think about it. With over 60% of the arsenal locked behind pay walls and RNG walls, anyone who wishes to have a remotely good arsenal to grind in PvE is heavily encouraged to either open loot crates, buy EMP guns (and half of them are unreasonably priced, I mean 20 bucks for a P90... HOLY ♥♥♥♥ MAN~!!!) or buy premium turrets which make such a major difference in Nightmare mode (don't let anyone fool you, I've run several nightmare missions on BDH and I've had a far FAR easier time when 1/2 my team is stalked up on gatty, flame and shield turrets...), because of the lack of proper guns that free players are capable of getting, this makes it such a chore to obtain reasonable enough gear to grind harder difficulties with. Also, when I say this game caters to whales and compulsive gamblers, is because, as I said, with the unreasonably priced weapons and gear (and having to spend 10 bucks at a time to open 4 loot crates, just 4 RNG BS LOOT CRATES), 20 bucks in this game doesn't get you ♥♥♥♥! So unless you plan on spending $100s-$1000s of dollars on this game to reveal lots o' targets n' loot crates and obtain soo many advantages over every other free player, just do yourself a favor and look for a more reasonable F2P game like Warframe, Firefall or Airmech... As I've said before, don't let anyone fool you that the bullet system is perfectly fair and that they used their first plat bullet in the first 10 hours of playing the game and got a perm Neutrino Rifle or Arc Cannon for free, as Dumb ♥♥♥ Luck doesn't happen to everyone, and it may take you 1000s of tries before you obtain what you want...

4)Lag, Lag everywhere... - This point is mostly for PvP as PvE doesn't suffer as much from lag as PvP does, and this is mostly because more than HALF the population consists of Brazilians. I have nothing personally against them, I love hispanic people, I am one... but I really REALLY hate Brazilian latency as the ping just... causes sooo much lag, between the warping and the Lag Armor(it could also be poor server optimization as well), it's just Unbearable to play PvP. One reason people avoid it like the plague is this, the other is...

5) no anti cheat system in place = Hackers, Hackers, HACKERS~!!! - This is especially true in PvP, there are 1000s of videos showcasing snappy aimbotters in this game, they have a HUGE advantage with aimbots in this game because of how high bullet magnetism is, you can literally headshot people with a sniper from 1/2 way a cross the screen without even scoping in, the Bullet magnetism is so high that I can play with a controller and do good, so imagine how many kills an aim botter could get, and sadly PvP is full of them, I've even had a couple of run downs with em, and the countermeasures to eliminate the botters at the moment is completely sub-optimal (to those who play the game, I just made a pun there...). The worst part is, like every other korean/chinese MMO released in NA out there, the american publisher acknowledges there are hackers, yet they do nothing about it, which sucks...

6) a few missions have extremely cheap enemies - As I've said, this game is hard and you WILL die a lot, but most of the deaths will feel like they were cheap and not your fault with some enemies, espeically when a bunch of exploding zombies or nade spamming zombies spawn right next to you, it will feel like playing in the arcades again with enemies that would kill you in 1-2 hits just to incentivize you to feed the machine more quarters, worst of all is the starter weapons are complete ♥♥♥♥ in PvE, so unless you have the proper anti weapon (ZK, Assault, Thresher) you will get your ♥♥♥ handed to you a LOT...

7) Horrendous spawn System- Holy ♥♥♥♥ this one is just really really bad here, the game for both PvP and PvE has preset spawns, and sadly in team based PvP this heavily promotes spawn camp rope which does happen a lot, especially in MvM and TDM, in PvE it's even worse for a lot of the zombie maps, imagine spawning right smack in the middle of 20 zombies with nowhere to run because you're stuck, BOOM, dead in 5 seconds because there was literally nothing you could do! For the most part this game doesn't have a Safe Spot spawning system or ongoing map rotation spawn which is total BS... and honestly a few seconds of spawning invincibility do nothing to fix this issue...

All in all this game is good fun for a few minutes despite being as generic as it gets, but the downsides along with it's heavily incentive on paying ♥♥♥♥ loads of money just to obtain things quicker, the lack of free to unlock (not RNG earn) weapons, and overall fairness just makes it impossible for me to recommend this game to anyone yet, If you can find a better and more Fair F2P game then just stick to that and avoid this one for now...

TL;DR version:

Game is good fun but pretty much sucks at everything else, caters too much to heavy spenders, has too many flaws in the mechanics especially the spawning, Lag and PvP hackers...

reviewText:
ZMR is a Third Person Shooter built of the same engine that Gears of War Judgement uses. It's actually developed by the same Chinese company, YingPei. It borrows the same chest-high cover mechanics and over the top melee executions but adds a lot more variety of PvE modes that run from classic Horde-mode maps to maps that pit you against gigantic T-Rexes with rocket launchers on their backs.

The game recently underwent a massive overhaul that rewards new players way more than the old system did. Where the harder maps were difficult to get into without spending money to accelerate your progression or being lucky at RNG, now the level rewards provide you with all the basic gear you need to get started on Nightmare content. Drones have been added to the game and allow you to customize and level them up to get them new abilities.

Bullet galleries have been overhauled again and thankfully all the temporary guns besides Epic weapons have been removed from the game completely. Buying VIP access for yourself gives you a chance to try out high-teir weapons for free and the selection changes every two weeks. There are lots of ways for free-to-play players to get access to the best weapons without having to do much more than invest some time into grinding, just like every other game on the market.

The PvP in this game has a pretty high skill cap in it so it can be difficult for new players from NA to adjust. Unfortunately the game has been out in other regions for years so a lot of the foreign players have a pretty significant advantage in terms of skill level. Hackers appear occasionally like most other online shooters, but EME is pretty quick to ban them as long as the community submits proof to EME's website.

As the oldest remaining player in the community, I would definitely recommend you pick this game up and try it if you're a fan of PvE-based online shooters. It's f2p so there's no harm in trying it yourself and none of the content is gated by a paywall. There are lots of helpful corps in the game for PvE and PvP who can help you get started regardless of your nationality.

8/10 would recommend to a friend.

reviewText: Prepare to be pummelled over the head with every nasty pay-to-win/pay-to-play tactic in the book. You're barely out of the tutorial before you find out that your starting equipment has a timer on it. From what I could tell most of the equipment bought with in-game currency could only be rented, which wouldn't be so bad if the weapons didn't average something like $15 of real money. Admittedly I didn't play for long, but that has more to do with the terribly bland level design and cheap enemy spawns than any in-game storefront.\n\nThis is a game I might have been willing to buy on sale for $10 but there's nothing about it that makes me want to 'rent' it.

reviewText:
I've been playing this game for a few months now so here it is.

Initially the game's name seemed cheesy and my prejudgement kept me from trying it sooner.
When I started playing I quickly found it addictive and overall pleasant to play.
I enjoy PVE content primarly and ZMR delivers well in this area.

I did find that, at the time I started to play, the game was highly pay to progress.  By that I mean if you wanted to get good gear/weapons at a reasonable speed you were best off paying.

This has been changed, for the better IMO, since the Games of Drones update.  You can now buy decent weapons in the gold money market (in game currency) and the rewards from bullets has also been made much more viable for free to play minded players.  I can't stay this enough, it is ALOT better since this patch.  Levelling rewards are so much better now.

This game is worth a shot.  Be warned that you might like it quite a bit and end up throwing some money to en masse anyways :)  I'd say it's done a good job of offering a great free to play experience now.

In all fairness some are still likely to not like it but that's ok too.  Try it out and find out for yourself.
There are still some elements where spending money gets you basically more chances at winning items you desire but that's basically it.  It's RNG and money just gives ya more chances" at something or gives you the option to buy faster XP / money gain percs.  I've prolly missed some more specifics but that is the gist of it.

Thanks for reading."

reviewText:
Do you like to fight against waves of enemies cooperatively with other players? Check!
In various modes; with multiple difficulties? Double check!

*Assault Ops pits you against mobs of enemies as you and your team fight through sections of levels, building up to a big baddie!
*Paranormal Ops sends you into undead infested areas--following along the lines of Assault Ops to a big ol' Raid like boss
*Extinction Ops is currently one of the newer mission-esque runs...but with dinosaurs! RAWR! Who doesn't want to gun down prehistoric creatures? :P

These three modes are perfect for those who prefer to work as a team.
That said; despite being a team, often times there is little communication between players; often fighting for ammo boxes, and the lack of objectives in these missions that require the team to split up. But overall still very fun.

*Threshold Defense is similar to tower defense where angry mobs of various enemies come in droves, and you're tasked to set kill-kill-kill-earn points and set up various turrets to subdue the opposition with said points! Advanced and above difficulties increase the number of waves and add a boss at the end!

A mode for the Tower Defense obsessive. ;D
Don't have many issues with this mode; other than points are hard to come by sometimes when you have a team who can murder things before they get two feet out of their spawn points, and you definitely need points to pick up ammo, set up turrets, use traps, etcetc.

*Kill Everything throws you into a map where the whole point...literally is to just rekt all the things, earn points and use them to unlock doors to other parts of the map; replenish ammo; pick up various guns and special weapons to demolish all the things! There's also traps throughout the maps to help even the odds, and you can rebuild windows/doors to slow the increasing numbers[see: give you breathing room].
*Kill Everything 2 is just a bigger and badder version of the previous with advanced and higher difficulties throwing a Boss at you; sometimes with limitless mobs to keep you on your toes.

These two modes are perfect for those who need to get their gun off like a sociopath. :P
Another point based set of PvE maps; so if you're not quick to kill the baddies, you might find yourself running around without ammo for a little bit until the waves get bigger.

*Assault is a competitive PvE set up where waves of enemies come try and make life difficult, they think they're Assaulting -you- but in reality, -you're- the one Assaulting them.
*Massive Assault is just a bigger version of the before; with more players, so you can Massively Assault the enemy's face. ;D

More or less a shooting gallery in which you compete with others to get the top score; who's the bigger, badder Assaulter? GET SOME!
No real problem, only that spawn points are predictable, so it's sometimes comical how fast a wave can be cleared if everyone camps specific spots.

DO YOU LIKE PVP? OF COURSE YOU DO! (But I sure don't...)

*Free-For-All one of the breads; and just as it sounds! You against ER'RY BODEH. I..I've got nothing else.

I am not a huge fan of this mode, it's very common to spawn into a middle of a firefight and get chewed up in the crossfire. Players will spawn in behind you after being caught in said crossfire and put you down in a vicious cycle. Though that said; lots of players DO LIKE the manic playstyle it provides.

*Team Death Match is the butter of PvP, Red vs Blue, Team A slap-fighting with Team B, etcetc.

I personally enjoy this mode of PvP, especially if the teams are balanced...otherwise, you can be, and will be...mercilessly spawn camped until the end of the round. Git gud

reviewText: This free to play third-person shooter gets a lot of bad reviews from people who don't play long enough to understand. a lot of people say it's pay to win but all the items you can buy, you can also earn in game easily. The game uses similar duck and cover mechanics found in games like Gears of War. Most guns can be bought with in game gold and the ones that can't be can be won through a bullet lottery system. Each time you complete a map on normal, advanced, expert, and nightmare you get bullets (tickets). Silver is the lowest and most common tier (normal.advanced), expert gives you a gold and silver, and nightmare gives you a platinum and two golds. Each bullets has a change to win you something useful (gear, guns, grenades, turrets, drones/drone parts). The higher quality the better quality gear you have a chance to get. The game has a mixed player base of south to north american players. So in PVP high pings can be annoying but they're really not a big deal. This game needs a massive injection of north american players in all honesty. Love the game and play it daily, has lots of content and it keeps growing. Great game to play alone or with a group of friends.

Z.M.R
What can i say? It really has it all (almost)
This game may sound stupid, but it is QUITE fun, and pretty straight forward about what it offers.
Of all the f2p games out there, this one really plays as a game you actually bought.

Sure, there are a couple of draw-backs. Like no story mode of any kind [not cool] If this game had a decent in-depth story mode i would say that it has it all. Another issue? the lag. You can have a 25 ping [like me] and still get some chop here and there, which can make game play not fun [ESPECIALLY in pvp] but i believe it is server side and they are working on it.

And frankly what game doesnt have its little glitches here and there? All and all this is a very good game, its VERY rewarding to the free player, i dis like the term pay to win"  no the guns you get from premium dlc are no better than their standard counter parts you can buy permanently with gold or rep currencies earned by playing. People are still damn good using stock weapons. The game is fast and fun and worth it if you liked gears of war

reviewText:
This game just tries to appeal to too many people. It borrow mechanics from Black Ops Zombies, Gears of War, heck, a little bit of Orcs Must Die even. But the problem is: it does none of those elements well. It's a bland shooter that's easily outdone by other games in the market, and isn't impressive what so ever. My first impressions of the game and my take on the action is here: http://youtu.be/4qRiLuLt9QM.

In short, there's not enough to commit me at least to want to even continue playing. The rent a weapon system feels like a cash grab, and while I like helping developers and have little problems paying for content: there's not much bang for buck here. There are other games that just do it better, and free ones at that. It's not worth your time.

reviewText:
After playing this game since Closed Beta i can highly recommend it to anyone who likes TPS or just wants a fresh MMO experience, the game has various pvp modes as any other Online Shooter but where it really distinguishes itself is in its outrageos amount of PVE content Including Wave based survival modes, mini campaigns for 5 to 8 players, Tower Defense spin offs and just updated with the steam launch a new kind of campaign-like mode featuring dinosaurs! with new content being added to the game in each month.
For those that dont know the developers of this game were formerly Epic Games China, creator of Gears of War, so this game also has an overall GoW feeling in the gameplay with great focus on the cover mechanics mixed with the various modes that resemble other titles like Killing Floor, L4D etc.
As a F2P it makes a decent job in providing weapons and items to free players, the publishers always listen to the players feedback and each update brings changes in the store resembling the community biggest concerns, most equipment can be directly bought from the shop or earned via a RNG shooting gallery wich you can access with special bullets that you earn after every PVE match, however the best weapons can only be obtained trough those RNG galleries and are nearly a requisite to run the harder modes in the game, meaning that you'll require to grind a really big amount of bullets if you expect to get any of those weapons in a permanent version, for those who can pay the sames rules apply for the shop and theres also loot boxes which can yield temporal or permanent versions of weapons, mods, techs and gear.
So in a brief summary.

Pros:
High variety of PVE modes
Decent F2P model
Constant updates adding modes and weapons
Changes in shop provided with users feedback
Gear and weapons provide no damage bonuses in PVP (Hooray!)

Cons:
RNG tied progression for both paying and free players
Small PVP community (might change with steam launch)
High amounts of grinding neccesary to get the best weapons

So in short it might not compete with some AAA similar titles but its at the very least a nice game to spend some time with, theres always something new to do, and can be really fun if you have friends to play with and joke around while you get killed by a T-Rex with missiles strapped on its back.

reviewText:
:Edit:

Given the current state of the game I can no longer recommend it.  Since my review the game declined to such a state that it can only be called, dying.  The development staff has been cut to one person in lieu of the current slate of mobile games that EME is working on.

The lag issues still persist, anticheat has been abandoned and given up to a current solution of just not allowing PvP by anyone under level 25 (the thinking was that bans would actually mean the loss of some time invested, but the problem is, bans arent actually happening any more ( read one developer on project), this leads to a very small PvP community and much animosity between the factions (brazilians vs turkish vs the remaning english speakers).

The game continues to get content updates direct from Yingpei, but at a much slower pace, and almost solely new over powered guns and PvE content.  Still not pay to win since it is still very RNG heavy, but the amount of time put in is not equal to the thrill of shooting off 300 bullets or opening up 300 packages to no avail.

It's become obvious to the community (as toxic as it may be) that the game is about to get disconnected, and the ones who stay are for the most part PvE centric and are only staying till their friends leave out or they all transition to a new game.

The only way I could still recommend this is if you are a brand new player and excited to see something a bit different. I can not in good conscience let you spend money on this though... do not invest in the game as I believe once the lease on the server runs out, it will be gone as most of the other ZMR versions in other countries have gone.


:End Edit:


I have played many a Free to Play game, and in doing so have seen some of the worst pay 2 win models, abandoned projects and just generally the worst aspects of this genre of gaming.  I originally went into ZMR with the same expectations that I would play for a few levels, find the free to play wall that almost every game of this type has and move on to something else.... that was in November during the Steam launch.

I can honestly say this is the absolute model for how I expect a Free to Play game to work from here on out.  The development staff is honestly involved with the game via the reddit and during weekly streams as well as in game. The paid transactions are scrutinized before release in order to maintain a free players ability to compete and have fun. The updates are regular and add new content and items (and not just reskinned or cosmetic skins, but actual new things to collect for free players) and there is no free player cliff via gated content or any other sort of have to pay to advance shenanigans.

I will break the rest of this review into a simple pros and cons.

Pro:
-Regular Updates
-Lots of content for PvE and PvP
-Actual mod developer interaction that actually effects the direction of the game
-Tons of guns
-Nice art style with a decent frame rate and graphics

Unfortunately there are still cons even after the Game of Drones" Update:
-Some mystery lag issues that only effect certain players at certain times (Being worked on)
-Still no anti-cheat (But report feature actually works and players are remvoed quickly)
-*ahem* Aggressive.. community (Not all
recommended:
but they are not the loudest)
-smallish population

All in all
hoursPlayed: this has been a great find
voteText: and after the "Game of Drones" update more stuff to do and more fun to be had.  Overall I'm glad to be a part of this community and I hope it stays alive for a good while longer.  If you enjoy shooters

reviewText:
I started playing this during steam release, and i gotta say, cant believe i havent tried it prior!  Reminds me of the blasts i had in killing floor!  It's all out WAR against everything you could think of! (well, almost!)  It has PvP... but that is not where the focus nor selling point is, its the coop!

I must also say that while there is easily a wallet sink in this game for those who have tons of dosh to throw away, that since i have started playing, i have enjoyed every minute of being a Free player.  I'm not at a disadvantage because i dont subscribe or spend money on equipment, and the time spent acquiring new gear/levels also gives you a chance to figure out all the cool nick-nacks/secret things that have to do with movement, weapons, and surviving all around, and i highly recommend NOT spending money on anything in the game for at least your first 40 hours, so you know what everything is, what you unlock at certain levels (which is pretty much everything u can buy when u start),

one thing that turned me off when i started but is not an issue at all once you've dropped a few hours in and done a few of the missions, is the fact that weapons/gear that you obtain for the most part have a limited time of use, IE have a timer.  most things range between 3 days, 1 week, and 1 month.
HOWEVER
this does not mean you are forced to spend money on the game either, especially not to acquire permanant weapons/gear;  you unlock permanant gear just for ranking up your character, and using silver/gold/platinum bullets at the shooting gallery.
After every match on normal/advanced u get a minimum of 1 silver bullet, which u can take to the 'shooting gallery' to take your chances at permanant gear.   the shooting gallery is a simple mini-game with no real challenge to it, u just pick a target and click to reveal the item behind the target.  i have already obtained 3 permanant weapons from the shooting gallery, (and that does not include the other 3 permanant weapons ive got from just leveling my character so far).

another thing people might be worried about starting off, is the revive system.  its pretty basic, but has a little to understand.   Pretty much, u get 3 revives per map free, IF you die.  You can be picked up while bleeding out, if you go down from taking too much dmg.  but if you bleed out, a team member can not revive you.  once this occurs you are forced to either use one of the free revive tokens to revive yourself, or u can team revive everyone.  if u team revive everyone while u have one of the 3 free revives left, it uses 1 of those free revives to revive you, and uses the other players free revives to get them back into the game, so it doesnt use yours.
If you run out of those 3 revives per map, u have a choice to use Revive tokens" which you obtain for completing missions
date: opening completion packs (for completing advanced modes)
recommended: and from the shooting gallery using all 3 types of bullets (silver/gold/platinum).  As long as you dont go into an extrememly hard map

reviewText:
2016 Edit: Game is dead. Play, but don't spend money unless they are releasing new content.

Original Review:
It's fun and free and doesnt suck!

I enjoy this game! It doesn't take itself seriously, but looks like it could. The graphics are pretty good, the action is fun, the controls are tight (Gears of War cover mechanics and Iron sights). I have rarely had problems with lag, or server crashes, and the community is pretty cool. People yab.

The only downsides of this game is a lack of content. Yea, there are some audio bugs, certain NPCs are mixed way too high and will destroy your eardrums. The DX11 setting (or was it 10) causes shadow glitches. Sometimes DOF causes your whole screen to blur out. But once you get your settings right, the game is fun . . . then you've played everything and you move on.

It's not pay to win . . . so much,  but I only play PVE, which I love.

I'll come back and play some more when they have a meaningful content update and throw them another $20 so I can get some cool looking stuff to pimp out my character (Just as much for me as it is to say Thanks for making this game . . . here is some money").

It's free. Try it."

reviewText:
This game is a TPS variety show, and I find it a lot of fun. On the PvE side, there are several different game modes ranging from wave-based survival to more elaborate multi-stage missions that end in a boss fight. During these missions you get to fight everything from guys with guns to Asian zombies (and regular ones) to Egyptian god-monsters to dinosaurs. These are not hour-long twenty-person raids where everyone has to do exactly his part, but I've only played the lowest of four difficulty levels. Besides, I like the ease of just dropping in even in the middle of a mission. Everything tells you not to take the game too seriously and just jump in to have fun. I am not into PvP, but the Merc vs. Monster mode is quite fun; I played one match as the monsters. There are like a dozen classes each with a special ability; I tried out invisibility and suicide bombing to good effect.

The movement in the game feels slow (I think the devs tried to make it tactical but I initially found it sluggish), and you may not like it. You have to try it for yourself to see if you can get used to it. It's the same with graphics, sound, controls, shooting, so on. Good thing it's free.

It is true that the weapons, weapon mods, other gear, and cloth in this game are mostly rented or bought with both real and in-game currency. However, contrary to the criticisms I've read, they don't adversely affect the game.  You start with some decent timed gear for free, but you also get a set of permanent basic gear so you never not have guns to shoot. There are easily completed misisons that reward you with additional timed gear. These missions, as well every match you complete, also reward you with in-game currency; you can use that to buy or rent guns. Permanent guns are very expensive, so don't expect to do it in ten hours; twenty maybe. Oh, and as your character levels up, and you get some timed and permanent guns as rewards in the process. So, while it appears greedy when you go into the store and everything is either cheaply rented or very expensively bought, you are still competitive with what you can get using in-game resources.

While we are on the subject, there are a good number of game modes and maps where you can either pick up guns dropped by enemies or trade them with points you earn during the match (like CoD Zombies). If you ever run out of free timed guns and have no currency to rent any, and the thought of using the basic gun offends you, those modes are still very playable.

The other major purchasable resource that I've noted is the Revive Token. Every match you get 3 free Revives, when you run out, you are out of luck and have to quit or use your stash of Revive Tokens. You get 50 in the beginning, and after every completed match you get a lottery bullet" that frequently gives a token as prize (gear otherwise). You don't die right away when you are down
date: you get a bleedout period when your mates can help you up
recommended: so that's another layer of protection for you. I've personally used Revive Tokens only rarely during the longer missions (most bosses are not Token reapers); I hardly even use the free Revives on the survival and hunting maps

reviewText: Many shooters have their own Campaign" (PvE) Co-op mode now
date:
but most of them only have one mode. ZMR takes the PvE modes we are most familiar with from other shooters and offers all of them in one game.

"Kill Everything Modes" that feel like Zombie Mode from Call of Duty PvE
"Assault Modes" that feels like Horde Mode from Gears of War PvE
"Threshold Defense" that is similar to a Tower Defense Shooter like Sanctum PvE
"Paranormal/Assault Ops" that are similar to Quest Mode from GunZ the Duel PvE

On top of familiar Co-op PvE Modes the game offers a fast paced PvP with many different game modes. The game is free so it's well worth the price

reviewText:
On the surface, Zombies Monsters Robots looks like a robust co-op experience, with plenty of freedom in terms of character advancement for its players and many opportunities for good, clean fun. However, just a few hours into the game, one will find glaring issues:

The engine is unoptimized as hell, and prone to crashing at the slightest irregularity. I've crashed while alt+tabbing numerous times.

The game has no class system, which is normally a big plus for me. Bit it also has no real party roles, either. Everyone is a lone wolf, looking out for his or herself. The only way to play a medic, for example, would be to equip the medic pack in one of your equipment slots which raises the rate at which you can revive wounded comrades. But the rate increase is minor, not worth the usage of a slot, and you rarely have the opportunity to revive party members anyway.

In order to unlock new equipment slots, you have to pay. This puts an instant, inalienable cap on the capability of free players.

The arguably best weapons are behind a pay-wall, or a ridiculous RNG whack-a-mole style shooting gallery where the function of tokens is fulfilled by bullets of various grades that you recieve for accomplishing tasks. The chance of a good weapon is abysmally low, even in the highest grade shooting galleries.

Even on the easiest difficulty, which is by no means hard, enemies who do manage to down a player will almost instantly execute them; leaving no chance for other players to come help. This is part of the reason that the game is so generous in the doling out of revive tokens; after several hours, you will have between 70 to 100 revive tokens. But a battle in which you must use a revive token is much less satisfying, especially when the token is used to patch up a cheap kill.

The difficulty hike from the first to second stage of difficulty is mind-bogglingly insane. Enemies that you could take down with a few body shots on the first difficulty will require at least three quarters of a magazine's worth of non-stop head-shots to bring down. It's insane.

The number of one-shot kills is insulting. One-shot kills and fast TTKs have their place in other genres of game. But in an over-the-top action hero game like this, where the bosses include 1980s DinoRiders references and Swiss Army Knife submarines, your character ought to be able to take a little bit of a beating before he goes down. Even with the +50% health buff equipment, which costs exclusive currency gotten specifically for completing some tasks, you will be one shot by obese remedial kids who I swear have the sound effects of some creature from a Godzilla film I once saw.

The Co-op missions are strung together in a haphazard fashion, with mission segments being broken up by frequent (far, far too frequent) cutscenes of a door opening. Or the camera panning over an array of enemies, spoiling the obstacles up ahead rather than allowing you to explore.

The game is now balanced around a metagame of players optimizing ridiculous looking 'drones,' which in effect turn everybody into a pet class. While this may appeal to some, I myself am not a fan of being pigeonholed into a feature which looks silly while having it play the game, even if it's just in part, for me.

Sadly, Zombies Monsters Robots is a game that was on the right track to be simply epic, but fails too hard in too many ways for it to be worth my continued attention. I would not be able to, in good conscious, suggest it to anyone. Wonderful, BEAUTIFUL concept, with a horrible execution in monetary model, presentation, and game-play. A huge let-down in every measure, and a depressing example of yet another failed co-op game.

Final verdict: Go back to Warframe.

reviewText:
Some of these thumbs down reviews are a little misleading for anyone hoping to enjoy this game for the first time. Of course it has it's marketing scheme, they want you to buy their product.

You start with a Heavy MG that lasts for thirty days and a Famas that last for seven days, as well two permanent guns; the 1911 and a Scar rifle. If you do a couple co-op missions you will unlock several decent weapons that you can hold onto for three days. So, you have a time frame for which you need to earn enough in-game credits to purchase another permanent weapon, which I would estimate to be around twenty hours of gameplay to afford. Also, there are maps you can play where you can pick up guns(Like the COD zombies modes). You could just do those until you had enough to afford a permanent weapon.
Anyway, enough about the weapons.

THERE ARE DINOSAURS WITH ROCKET LAUNCHERS ON THEIR BACKS!

The are of course some minor glitches;  movement frustration can happen but you should easily figure out the simple issues, wall cover is a little iffy, enemies can spawn glitched sometimes, and allied player revive is a little clunky. Yes, sometimes monsters will all follow the same person attacking them and somewhat stunning them in place. That person being followed needs to roll, and quickly begin sprinting hoping their teammates will 86 any pursuing enemy.

The good things I've noticed in PVE mode - haven't played PVP - ;Registration on the NPC's heads seems nice, plenty of game modes to keep you interested, and plenty of game types melded together.

The voice acting is meh and the sprinting panting noise is annoying, but the sound effects aren't so bad. All in all the game deserves a thumbs up in my, 6.7 hours of gameplay, opinion.

reviewText:
We're doing fine. I'd give it a 9!
9.95

This was a game I was hyped up for and I must say it lived up to my expectations and surpassed them.

I have to say I think this game is better than the new Resident Evils and the Gears of War series. The monsters and map designs are definitly better.

That is ultimatly the main appeal to ZMR and it knows it. People want to shoot Zombies, Monsters and Robots and it delivers. The thing that really suprised me was the Mummies and dinosaurs. T-Rexs with rockets attached to them.

The maps are simply some of my favorite in all of gaming, notibably the aztec pyramid, and tropical map.

My only main problem in this game is the movement. Character animations are okay, and movement is good, but not as good as Gears, Uncharted or Resident Evil.

I say this because if they fix that one problem this could be one of the greatest thirdperson shooters of all time. As of now the character movement is good, but not as amazing as the maps and monsters

Really once I find a game I love, and I do LOVE ZMR I seek out ways to improve it. So here are my suggestions.


More Focus on Soundtrack, I mean this game would be a lot better if it had a great soundtrack to go with it.
Forget realistic boring guns, give us unique badass guns.
And Aliens.

My final suggestion is just to add more character to the game, like have more awesome things for the character to randomly say durring battle, maybe an announcer that says DOUBLE KILL or crazy effects, something like pyrovision in TF2 as an example.

But really character animations/movement and soundtrack/announcer would greatly improve this game.

Also a haunted mansion and school map would be awesome.

reviewText:
OverviewGameplay: 7/10
Sounds: 6/10
Multiplayer: 6/10
Graphics: 7/10

Pros & Cons+ Great PvE quality
+ Wide selection of PvP & PvE maps
+ Different game modes from mechs to humans vs monsters
+ Animated cutscenes
+ Character customization
- Stiff character animations
- Small player base
- Average/poor character voice acting
- Bugs
- Several questionable design choices


ConclusionZMR tries to be every game at once, but does a mediocre job at best. It has almost anything from tower defense, to capture the flag, to co-op missions to even mech battles! However once I started playing I began to notice something very off about each...but I can't seem to put my finger on it. Disregarding some of the strange design choices such as no momentum between zig-zag movement and spam-cover-direction to dodge bullets ZMR is a quality F2P if you're bored. Sadly the playerbase is quite small.

7/10

reviewText: ZOMBIES! DINOSAURS! ALIEN BUG THINGS! A LOT OF BULLET! TERRIBLE CUTSCENES AND VOICE ACTING! AND WOMEN IN VERY PROVOCATIVE CLOTHING WHICH MAKES NO PRACTICAL SENSE IN THEIR SITUATIONS! What else would you want from a game?\n\nAfter 5 hours of Zombies Monsters Robots, I had a lot of fun playing this game except for one aspect… it is very repetitive and I like games with… a more structured story. For an MMOTPS to even have a story really shocked me :O But they are all individually single mission based :( The PvP is really bland too but yet really really fun! Especially the monsters vs machine mode… I think that is what is it called. I had a lot of fun playing this game and I would honestly play a lot more of it if only the servers weren’t so laggy. I still HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone as it is sooooo fun :D

reviewText: A Third Person cover based shooter where you will fight damn near anything and everything. With colorful designs and wacky off the wall scenarios I feel anyone who knows what fun is will be hard pressed not to like this game. While this game has your standard team deathmatch and free for all competetive game modes this game really shines in its co-op modes. Everything from objective based missions, to zombie survival, wave, and even tower defense this game will provide you with the variety you want from your typical shooter without the typical shooter atmosphere.

reviewText:
First of all, this game is NOT P2W. THE ONLY thing u can't get without money (that's actually worth anything besides just cosmetic) is emp costumes. Everything else is or will be avalible. Yes you can pay money to get stuff sooner. The game is free to download and play. Most games cost $50-90 just to bring it home then god knows how much to keep playing it online... If you want an example of P2W for this game google Hazard Ops".

PR0S:
- Free dlcs that get released every so often.
- No P2W methods in this game.
- Fun game modes such as Threshhold Defense

column18: Free for All
column19: and lastly Mech Battles PvP.\n- You can earn "bullets" in a difficulty for each game mode such as "silver bullets"
column20: "gold bullets"
column21:
and lastly "platinum bullets". These bullets can be use in the shooting gallery of your inventory menu for a chance to win permanent guns to advance through the game.
- Huge amounts of weapons and gear can be obtained via bullet range or in-game store.
- Corporations or Guilds (with no bonuses except for another chat tab) can be made or joined.
- Ranked Matches (event only) are hosted once in a while.
- Players or AI can get downed and be executed by an enemy unless revived by another player.
- Has a reloading bar mechanic from Gears of War (mainly because one of the producers of Gears worked on this game).

C0NS:
- About 40% (more or less) of this games population is made out of Brazilians from another version of this game called "Hazard Ops".
- Ping can constantly go over 50+ .
- 95% of your hits will be on target.
- Few Cutscene are a bit bugged.
- No anti-cheat is implemented ... yet.
- Horrible balancing system if PvP settings are set to balanced (ex: 6v1)
- Players that pay for gear and weapons can gain a slight advantage to players who play for free.
- Snipers and Shotguns can be one hit kills.

TL;DR: This game is fun

reviewText:
Well given the some bad reviews on this game here, plus the name made the game kinda sound dumb I decied to give it a shot myself ( and seems like the biggest mistake of my life on terms that I am freaking glued to this game now. )

I am not even sure how else to explain this game but with just saying   It is freaking fun to play, and can get pretty challenging too.

While it does have its problems though, in my opion its not really that breaking though as most of it can be avoided by getting used to playing it in certain ways ( like  one being  run, dodge and take cover use the same key sometimes making situations where you want to run make you take cover if your to close to a wall. )

Also while the in game gold  shops take alot of gold for permenate weapons you can also  win  those using the silver bullet range, as well as winning cashshop stuff from the gold  range. While silver bullets from games  are easier to get (finishing normal/advanced games, gold ones require y ou do to expert games. ) Also besides that stuff there are some exclusive weapons and things you get solely from platnium bullets  and those come from completeing the nightmare difficulty of games.


If you are into shooters I would have to say you really should give this game a try and at least give it enough time to get used to it, you might find you really like it just like I did


I will give this game a 8.6 out of 10, reasons being why not 10 out of 10 is because

Run take cover and roll are the same key, sometimes making you do something else instead of what you wanted to do if to close to cover or used to being able to tap run.

Game gets repetiviave but if you used to playing lobby shooter games then this would not be much an issue ( I personaly have no issue with it but its listed for those who thinks its a open world mmo or something lol, cause its not its a lobby room based shooter game. )

Controls are easy to learn but the game itself is hard to master and  be prepared to die a lot and takes a while  getting down the playstyle ( again for me not a real issue but this day and age  lots of impatent people. )

As you will notice up there  some of these issues I do not really care about but it was listed in seeing that ussaly some of them will get called out but for what this game is     it does it pretty darn well.

So instead of taking reviews words for it though, why not give this game a shot and see if it is something you like, what  could you possibly lose  other than maybe you like it and it eats up your free time.

reviewText:
Product received for free

So I love this game, it is ridiculously fun, even more so with a group of friends. I was hesitant to get it at first, but my friends talked me into it.

Important Part: When I got it installed, I could get the Launcher to come up, but couldn't get the Play button to activate/the real game to load. I looked at all the troubleshooting stuff and none of it worked. I put in a ticket after about 2 hours going through the forums on my own and they actually responded by the next morning. Giving me the standard troubleshooting advice, however one thing they said I just humored them on, and it turned out it was the problem.

SUPER IMPORTANT PART: I have AVG anti-virus and it was blocking the game without giving any type of notice at all. I finally got it to run by exempting the entire ZMR folder. Runs like a DREAM now. Probably doesn't need the whole folder exempted, but I'm not computer savvy enough to know EXACTLY what does need exempted because the Launcher.exe wasn't enough to get it to work.

So anyway, that conflict problem seems to be the root of several complaints I've seen. Once you get past that, Ive been having a blast. I've logged 22.6 hours in 2 days. 9pm-4am with friends
date: then 3pm-8pm solo and 8pm-3am with friends. Back to Back
recommended: More Gaming than Sleeping! I recommend it!\n\nOh

reviewText: ZMR may be one of lamest names when you tell someone to play something call Zombies Monsters Robots" Not to mention the picture they used is awful. However
date:
this game has given me a lot to do and is rather fun and interesting just based on how much there content there is to do. For lower end computer users like myself this is one of the better overlooked F2P that's came from somewhat pay to win a year ago to now you can get just about anything you can buy in the store. Just doing all the maps will take you a fair amount of time. The only real downside of this game is

1.Ping: If you live outside the states you will have higher ping which can be frustrating with pike spikes lately.

2. PvP: There have been hackers(Not as many as people think) but unless they have pure aimbot they just have a bit more of an edge
recommended: but there isn't too many people I would say are unkillable as I normally come out positive playing whatever mode I'm doing as it should be played and still do fairly well 70% of the time. There is a learning curve to pvp for newer people but like every game it will just take you a few tries to learn the do's and what you should not do. Lvl 15 is also a bit of a turn off but that was to prevent return of aimbotters though it is a lot more rewarding and easier leveling up then when I joined. Playing a Nightmare map was rarely ever seen nor possible unless you payed for turrets or were lucky enough to get the assault crossbow which they basically give you now in a mission you can do daily. reviewText: I only found out about this game the day before it came out, got hyped, downloaded the day it came out and it has to be one of the best free to play games I have played so far gameplay wise. It has zombies, pirates, robots, military, and dinos with rockets and more! The one downside is the guns you get playing the game only last from 3-30 days about. You can spend real money to get guns permanantly but that cost money, the one other downside is customization. Its not very broad. Other than that the graphics are great, gameplay is addicting, matchmaking is so fast, so many unlocks and the co-op missions are long and end with boss battles while pvp is the basic and fun deathmatch style gameplay! I would recommend this to anyone who loves shooters or action games!

reviewText:
So there's a few thing new players should know about ZMR.

- Is this pay to win?

No because, literally every weapon you see in the store, regardless whether it's paid by game cash or real money, can be obtained free and as a permanent through the, Bullet Shooting Gallery" located in your Locker/Inventory screen. Mods and Tech items are available in the shooting gallery as well as rental items and some mods or tech aren't available in the store
date: making some quite rare and maybe useful. One exception to this is that the Sentinel Gear is currently available as a random drop reward from Loot Cases
recommended:
but that's about it.

- Revive Tokens

You can earn a lot of revive tokens by simply playing and do a bit of farming in the PVE modes. So obviously
hoursPlayed: this means you do not have to buy them at all. And also
voteText:
don't forget to check your Locker for some free revive tokens upon making a new character.

- Do costume/gear stats work in pvp?

No

reviewText: It's a pretty fun F2P shooter. What's unique about this one is that its an RPG shooter, which means you get a bunch of collectible weapons, mods, and accessories, as well as npc pets to make yourself stronger. And you'll need them, because the hardest difficulties are absolutely nervewracking and require lots of teamwork and strategy, as well as good aim.\n\nPaying gives you certain conveniences - it's like pretty much every decent" f2p game system nowadays where you "pay to grind less". Not the best
recommended: but not blatantly pay2win like some games. One important thing to note is that you can get everything needed to finish the hardest difficulties without paying
hoursPlayed: but if you actually wanna not look like a generic redneck you're gonna have to pay some $$.\n\nAll in all I would recommend this game

reviewText:
If there was a Maybe option instead of yes or no.  Well it is Free to Play, give it a try if you like Shooter games with Co-op PVE and PVP.

En Masse has a big store of stuff to sell you for this game, including weapons, mecha, drones, i guess i can call it Pay to Win.  Forum said, Not many people playing in NA servers,  mostly people from SA.  Forum said, there is no anti-cheat system so you might meet hackers on server.  Sort of looks cheesy.   Not sure if you can get mecha and drones for free.

Does have a cover system. Kill zombies and aliens.


=============store description=================
Zombies Monsters Robots (ZMR) is the ultimate shooter playground, delivering more game modes, maps, and enemies than you can pull a trigger at. Take on an endless variety of freakish enemies in co-op campaigns and wave-based survival modes or go head-to-head against players in classic and unique PvP matches.   En Masse is the developer.

reviewText:
Good game.

With all honesty, Zombies Monsters Robots is actually a great game.
However it's a small community mostly with veterans.

I've spend roughly $600 not because it's p2w but to get easy assess to weapons, with all means, it doesn't mean it's p2w cos im paying for stuff which i can easy obtain via shooting gallary. Everything is obtainable buy farming bullets from any mode

Now it's talk about PVP. Someone who is new to 3rd person shooting, get ready for your ♥♥♥ to get kicked multiple times by veterans. Their guns are not p2w but it's the skill difference between players.

With the current community, it's best to play with a corp since it will give you motivation to keep playing and meet new people.
HOWEVER
because it's a small community, people will claim to be the best" at pve or pvp. If you get in a way of a corporation or guild they will put you down with words or even threaten you.

TL;DR
ZMR is a good game but the community is terrible without any management. Prepare for constant harassment by other players. Best to play with people you know or stay in a corporate/guild. it's not the game that will put you off
date: its the community\n\nI've told myself i would quit the game but i'm here to for my corporation and friends as they are my motivation to play."

reviewText: Really awesome game, been playing all day, super competitive, lots to work for and there's ranked matches once you hit level 10. Lots of headroom for strategy and some really big plays, clan functions and all. The game has some serious potential, I'll definitely be supporting this one. It's a total rip off of gears of war but I wouldn't have it any other way, I understand that there was a few developers from Epic games which is the team that made gears of war. The playerbase is growing fast and watching gameplay doesn't do too much justice, just try it for yourself, it's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly addicting. This is the best F2P shooter I've ever played, the graphics are nothing special which is okay because that just means it will run on more peoples computers. :) I give the game a 9/10, it's missing a point because the name is extremely tacky and repulsive, it sounds like a kids game, but really it could grow to be one of the top competitive games if more people start playing. This is coming from a GoW PvP veteran.

reviewText: Great Game but you will have to invest some time in this game to get new guns, clothes and Mods. Idk why this game had such bad reviews I find it one of great free to play games out there.  Give it a few hours of play also try and get a few friends to join in makes a great lan party game.\nUpdate!!:The issues with this game happens latter on when you realize you have to putt $30 to $80 on revealing targets in the shooting arena for end game Guns. I think this is what killed this game the last 30 days only 120 people on avg have played this. I feel the developers should have put out some end gun weapons in DLC for $40 bucks that lets to pick a few end game weapons that way if you wanted to get some good guns you’re not throwing money in the everlasting money pit that you could maybe get a good gun. This game is awesome til you realize it’s whoever throws the most money at it gets all the great weapons. I now understand why people gave this game a bad rep. I still recommend this game but be warned end game guns are really hard to get unless you put in $30-$80.

reviewText: This is a great game. It's Gears of War meets Call of Duty's Zombies meets ridiculous weapons and bosses and equals massive carnage and a great time. However, the North American server is now plagued by frequent lag, disconnects, and people that should be playing on the South American server due to where they live, but don't. It seems like they've forgotten the North American server, causing the aforementioned problems. I love this game, and I would love to see it return to it's original state. Please, devs, make it great again. ;-;

reviewText: Looked like a good game, until you find out that free players are stuck with the starter weapons. The store only takes EMP for weapons and attachments, meaning that you can only buy with real money. Free players can only get PERMANENT weapons (the other option used to be rental, but they got rid of that) through the shooting range which gives the chance to get weapons, exp, money, etc. But the odds of you getting anything good is so low that they actually have ways for you to pay real money to boost your chances buy paying into higher trier galleries. The graphics are poorly optimized (I can run the battlefront beta at max in HD and still get better fps) and the pvp is just who payed more for their guns. Empty rooms everywhere and all that is left is people who have never played cover based shooter, die in a corner surrounded and ask me to team revive them. The game says free to play, it means pay to not be stuck with starter everything forever but if you want to be dead weight then go ahead cause it’s FREE.\n

reviewText:
Ever wish Gears of War did Nazi Zombies first? Oh, wait, they sort of did... that's why we have Horde Mode as a term...

SO...uh... Ever wish you could play a less visceral and more bland-ish Gears of War Horde Mode type game on the PC? Well, it's your lucky day.

Functionally. The game works. It just feels bland. None of the guns feel like they have their own identity. Enemies, while there are a lot of reskins, seem to be just that. The environments look dated. In co-op most ai enemies either exist to run at your face as quickly as their relative size can carry them, or to stand at a distance and peck at you from outside cover. There are a few cheap enemies (Looking at you Mr. Barrel Toss) but dominate strategy seems to be just to trick the AI's pathing to confuse anything slightly dangerous. Most of the Co-op enemies basically come straight from either Gears of War, or Nazi Zombies. You have Tickers, Flamers, Boomers (even with the same type varity, grenade launcher flavor and shield flavor)... You probably get the idea. I understand that a lot of those work to punish different tactics and to keep you on your toes, It just feels a little...cease and desist-y...

As far as controls, it's just an average (an arguement could be made for slightly below average) third person cover shooter. The running, dodging, and cover controls feel a little... laggy... for lack of a better term. In Gears, Roadie Run and Roll were the same button as Cover. Whick worked in Gears, and added a signature 'weighty' feel to the controls. And a lot of it may have been the devs working with the controller limitations. But I'm sure a better control solution could have been worked up for this game, as opposed to Hey

reviewText:
For the price of free, this is a pretty good game.
NO, it's not P2W... though to play certain PvE stages, I'd imagine there would be quite a grind to get enough revival points to play to the end without paying.

For that matter, I quite like the fact that there's only one weapon that seems to be available instantly from the shop with just purchased currency, and it doesn't seem overpowered at all. (not counting certain other weapons which are unlocked w/a combination of silver bullets/currency/etc... which I haven't even encountered yet)

A list of pros and cons (which are slightly biased)
---------------------------------------------------
Pros:
- Lots of variety for both PvP and PvE modes; sometimes completely changing the way the game is played
- You CAN get permanent weapons with ingame-earned currency. It just takes a while; I would estimate a shorter grind than even Blacklight, however. (and definitely shorter than Warframe)
- NOT P2W. (as far as I know)
- Starts you off with a fair amount of gold and a gold increase booster, etc etc etc...
- So far the community seems nice enough. Or quiet if nothing else.

Cons:
- Servers seem to disconnect once in a while- though then again this game is new to Steam so this might only be a temporary thing, hopefully.
- Get stomped in classic Team Deathmatch mode by snipers. (though in all fairness, most of these snipers are using weapons purchased with ingame currency, not P2W... just a bit of a grind)
- Have to pay (or grind/wait) to revive more than 3 times in PvE, otherwise losing progress/rewards as it counts as a leave." In all fairness you DO start off with 50 additional revive points
date: but still...\n- Permanent weapons unlockable with ingame currency are pretty basic (though nonetheless viable) and relatively few. (not counting random chance for bullet ones)\n- (personal opinion only) not enough customization options
recommended: even costumes/customization options that are for cash would be appreciated. On the other hand the game's still new.\n\nStill would reccomend ZMR so far. It's not amazing or anything
hoursPlayed: but it's fun and has lots of things to do... which is good enough for me."
voteText: September 21, 2014

reviewText: Okay so i havent played this game enough to be the best at it but ive got a good feel for it. the way i see it if you love GEARS OF WAR 3,2,1 and NAZZI ZOMBIES in CoD youl love the PvE in this game there is one game mode where one side is the monsters one side is the merc's it feels ALOT like Nosgoth Like i mean ALOT witch is pretty cool you get like 4to5 games in one BUT the lag is real sometimes but they work on it alot the game is an pretty amazing F2P game if you like shooters and killing zombies get it Asap so to rap it up PROS: Good pve/pvp content {updates friequently}. Good graphics. decent amount of maps{updates somewhat friequently}.And lots of game modes  CONS:Lag is an issue sometimes but i have faith they will Fix it.Somewhat odd controls {to me atleast}.If you suck at the game youl be useing ALOT of revives wich cost money {but they can be bought with ingame money also}and if your lazy then you can pay to win BUT if u put some work in to it you get the same stuff for FREE.

reviewText:
(TL;DR at bottom, read the full thing if interested.)

Without a doubt, this game is going to be on my play list for quite a while! This game has a feeling to it that I can't explain. It has a rather serious side to it if you wish to get into that much, but it has such a funny and nonserious side to it that I think everyone can really grow to love! This is one of my favourite tps's out there by far, and I can't seem to want to play anything else but it!

Lets run through the pro's of this game:
Hit registration is absolutely amazing! I can actually tell when my bullets should hit and miss and it does a very good job of making that happen! If I see a bullet hit a wall, it's obviously missing anything, and if i see my bullet hit their head, I get a headshot! (Looking at you CS:go)

There's tons of inventory space, like right from the get go you can buy 100 guns if you want to and you'll have the space for it.

Tons of achievements. That's right, the game has a ton of ingame achieves that you can bring yourself to the test with. The game even displays how many points you've earned with your achievement progress which is pretty awesome!

Get back in the game! The game has a revival system if you didn't exactly do too well on your last life. For most missions you get a few free revival tokens that you can use before you start dipping into your revival tokens. You can get these back by completeing some missions so it's rather win win!

Item combination, If you have 2 of the same gun because you progressed really fast or mistakingly bought one, you can combine the weapons together or items to get a longer duriation on that item! I only had about 2 hours left on my ak but i had one with a few days on it and managed to get it up to like, 8 days. That made me pretty happy honestly.

PVE, the pve is absolutely awesome and I keep coming back for more. I honestly can't describe how addictive it is to play some of the modes on there. Theres so many difficulties and levels that it's really hard to not want to keep trying and keep advancing!

Playercards, Yea this isn't really a big deal but it's pretty cool that you can get a nice shiney card to display your achievements with along with it showing you your dps and what not. It's rather impressive going into a lobby and flaunting off a really high dps to everyone else without even having to say it!

PVP, there is ranked pvp on this game which is pretty cool! I haven't went into myself because i'm still new to the game but it's rather impressive that you can have a competative side to this game that seems so silly and care free! So there's a bit of everything for everyone who wants to play!

Silven/gold/plat bullets, The game gives you some bullets depending on the achievement you unlocked, level you just got or whatever else. These bullets give you a chance at some really awesome items! I got a permenant gun out of one of these and a playercard, along with a ♥♥♥♥ ton of coins and turrets and trial weapons. The list is so wide of how many items you can get through this little minigame  that it's really fun! You can get some really awesome t hings out of it and I don't even know the full list currently.

I can't currently think of anymore pro's but the cons list is going to be rather short. So lets start.

Temp Items, Now now I know most of you look at this and want to go away but stay a while and listen. This is a con for most people because it's like i don't want to have to keep getting my guns over and over" but honestly
date: the game gives you such a high amount of cash that it doesn't even really matter. I honestly have like
recommended: 10~20 guns sitting around in my inventory with weeks on them. And I just started playing! The game gives you so much money that the  temporary item system doesn't really matter all that much
hoursPlayed: seeing as you get about 2000+ coins every match.\n\nTemporary server lag
voteText: due to steam flooding the servers are currently a little overwhelmed because there's a lot of us players on here
helpfulPercent: but honestly they've already worked out the kinks so far so the servers are already running smooth as all hell!\n\nPassed that I honestly can't think of anything else except some people may look the same since the customization has a rather small  selection
votesHelpful: but even then you can buy yourself some gear to look different from the rest. The voices can be a bit silly if they don't match your character but that goes with every game with creation
votesTotal: so this is kind of a pro and a con.\n\nSo yeah
votesFunny: that's about it for my review of this game! I seriously recommend this game to anyone! I think you'll find it's sillyness and gameplay will be absolutely enjoyable. Oh
commentsCount: I also forgot to mention you can get some sick ♥♥♥ sword to use for completing a certain mission! It's really fun to use!\nThanks for taking the time to read my review

reviewText: This is a fun game.  I remember playing like spec ops or something on combat arms back in the day and this game kind of reminds me of that with the twist in gears of war horde mode or something like that.  It doesn't take long to get the jist of things.  Whether you do pvp or pve server, there are tons to do and with that said, always be a team player and your squad will somehow survive.  I know the devs still have ♥♥♥♥ tons to do with the game, and with it being free to play as well, I don't expect it to be perfect and I expect some net code errors to surface.  If you are unable to launch this game from steam from the launcher, the fix is very simple.  Go to the root of steam and get into steamapps and ZMR.  Find the ZMR launcher on the very bottom of the list and execute.  It will patch the game, give you a few errors, and then you do the same process and click on play.  When I ran the game under steam, the launcher would not patch nor would it execute to the loading screen it just stayed blank at the launcher.  This little workaround should help.  Aight, go blow ♥♥♥♥ up.

reviewText:
A nice splurging shooter which has something for everyone and then some. Companies have to make money somehow compared to other reviews that have come before this, which is way there is pay now or earn it avenues, so the game caters to life nicely. Plently of modes to choose from in PvE and PvP, nice selection of weapons and overall a fantastic time of satisfying your battle fever. The game  has come a major step of the way in terms of past reviews, and again, this is due to a supporting team listening to its fan base.

Overall ZMR, with its supportive team, has accomplished and still remains to this day, true to the shooter genre, and acheives what some shooters have failed to think and act upon.

Tutorials - On key, directional, and at your own pace.

Gameplay - Very Nice, fluid motion, handful of action, sensible balance of challenge

Gear - Pay for it or Earn it, Buy some nice gear or work for it and have chances to earn additional items in the shooting gallery.

AI - A bit unfair at times, however, with skill and luck you can overcome the odds.

Overall Charcther Shaping - A few hours everyday for a casual player will net them substatial rewards and good experience.

reviewText:
IF you are thinking of giving this game a try, then do so.

There are a lot of negative reviews right off but you can ignore them if they were written before the end of October. Why?  A lot of them complain about issues that have long since been addressed by the publisher and therefore are meaningless. These reviews, needless to say, have not kept up with the content that has been added since they were originally written.

Further, ZMR is a game that takes time to get into. If you only play for 30 minutes to a couple hours then you have not spent nearly enough time to experience the variety of maps and game modes available. You have not spent the time to achieve even one level for your character or complete any of the daily missions.  You have not had the chance to play enough maps to earn the rewards that help your character.

ZMR is definitely not P2W.  Even your starting weapons work just fine in all the PvE modes.  PvP is a bit harder but plenty of my PvP opponents use the basic starting rifle to kick butt just fine.

ZMR has its issues like any other game but the publisher is very responsive to the community.  The game continues to undergo changes to make it better.  I've played it daily for 3 months now and I'm not bored yet.

reviewText: I love the game and have been playing since beta. I'd recommend this game to anyone that likes TPS games and gears of war style gameplay. However, my one and major gripe (which in my opinion, means life or death of this game) is the shop system. Yes, it's a rent this weapon, spend a ♥♥♥♥♥on of time grinding for a permanant version, or pay real money game. While it may put you off and it puts me off, it's still a pretty good game. I'll recommend it for people who don't mind these types of games but if you're not a fan of the renting system, ignore it. I hope they change this once the game really grows but 'till then, think I'll play once in a while but won't dedicate much time to it.

reviewText: This game is way funner than it probably has a right to be. There are some boring game modes and for the most part you will be playing with mechanics heavily inspired by Gears of War shooters for every single one, but there is something about spending some time in a Jurassic Park inspired level fighting dinosaurs and sabretooth tigers then jumping to an Ancient Egypt inspired level to fight mummies and Egyptian gods and finishing a session off by mowing down waves of zombies as a palate cleanser.\n\nRegular Free-to-Play tropes exist but they're easy enough to ignore. Biggest issue is that if you die too many times you just basically fail a mission.

reviewText:
Hi, my nick is EvaLiepzig and i'm will talk about Zombies Monsyer Robots, published by Enmasse.

I'm play this game since 28 of Dicember of 2012, in MARS from LevelUpGames, i came to ZMR in 1st October of 2014, and still on it until nowdays.

The game, originaly from Yingpei, ZMR or QQSM in china by zygames, even MARS taking by instaler (Mercenary Assault and Recon Squad) is a third person shooter, many people says that remembers GearsOfWar, in fact who likes GoW loves this game, ZMR is divided in 2 modes PvP and PvE, but with main focus on PvE.

PvP: the pvp of ZMR is pretty good, have a big variety of modes and weapons, including weapon customizations and weapons with diferent skins, ones who have special atributes like more ammo or stability

PvE: (my favorite mod) Well ZMR pve is amazing, honestly is hard to see a Pve mode with the variety of modes and maps who have in ZMR, you will fight 2 classes of enemies the AS who are the soldiers, robots dinossaurs and machines and the ZK who are zombies and monsters,for this mode you have a large variety of equipment and weapons like drones, mechs (can be used in pvp, in mech pvp battles) and epic weapons  who are the most powerfull type of weapons, in class of weapons you have the normal ones, Assault, Zk, treshers (who are usefull for both mods) and epics, the difference of types of weapons are the damage and propose of what then was made for, like for example, assault and zk weapons are verssons of normal ones to pve, who gain more damage and ammo, The drones you have the Mk I -III and epic ones, were the difference is in their atributes.

ZMR, have a big variety of weapons and character customizations, invluding gears and uniforms, those ones who can be verry familiar, considering that the drop of itens in ZMR enmasse is considere verry apreciated vecause you can get powerfull stuff without spend much and even without spend money.

ZMR graphics are pretty good, mainly the bright of explosions and shoots what makes interesting, but dont excpect nothing like Bf4 with details in scenario destruction or  amazing effects  in veichles explosions,  game have good textures and looks good, it uses the unreal engine, like GoW. By steam nowdays, population isn't much, mainly because most people  prefer to log in by own enmasse client, but steam is a god way to put EMP when you is from outside USA, a thing who i see as a excelent caracteristic in ZMR, because here in enmasse server you can find people of entire world, what is verry interesting and funny, the major caracteristic of ZMR is that is a funny game.

If you is in doubt about ZMR i can say that i play this game have almost 4 years and only playing by steam i have more than 1859hours of gameplay here, and i'm not a player who uses steam much and i can say with security that i have near maybe even more than 5000hours of gameplay in this game.

Thanks and i hope that the new players enjoy the game. :)

reviewText: I haven't quite played this game for all that long, but so far it seems fun.  Although I've heard many pay to win accusations, I haven't seen it myself yet.  Overall, the game is a pretty fun free-to-play game, with good aspects from other games, and many unique things. reviewText:
ZMR is a great game I've played. It has both its ups and downs, some content more frustrating than most but overall it is definitely a game worth trying out.

First of all, ZMR is both PVP and PVE, so those who want a good natural fight against others or want to team up against the world will expect a good choice. PVP offers a great variety of modes and maps to play on and PVE does the same. Gear and customization of the character looks amazing.

The only downside I have to ZMR are about two things: PVP balance and Revival.

In most PVP oriented games, there are usually servers with levels caps such as levels 1 - 10 can only play on a certain server. This works out great for new people, as they can grasp the concept of the game and CQB, however it is extremely unfair and very much a slap in the face when you hit level 11. You go from babysteps, to ill-join-a-game-for-10-seconds-and-then-get-shot-in-the-head-by-a-sniper-because-thats-all-everyone-is-using matches. I don't wanna call any sniper players out, but this is really is pathetic of ZMR to suddenly kick a newly fresh player who may stilll not grasp the game fully out onto a field where players that are 50X their level will swoop in and feed on them. I honestly felt like target practice for pro players after not being able to go into the newbie servers. You can't even do your PVP missions anymore at that point because everyone is deep in their base in cover acting like Assassins Creed and then quickly shooting one bullet that kills you with a sniper.

The other bad thing is revival. While it is very nice to save your teammate and being able to get them up, the system is ridiculous. Whenever a teammate goes down, they drop their weapon, and if a teammate is near enemy bodies; they are near other weapons as well. See, when I try to revive my teammate, im directly over their weapon as well. I basically end up picking up their weapon instead and they die in front of me as if i didnt even try. It is honestly frustrating there isnt a different button for revival or a different system.

Overall the game is great, if you are seriously a competetive pvp and pve oriented person this is a game you should try, espicially with friends.

reviewText:
That strange moment when you're playing a Gears of War-inspired shooter and then you're suddenly playing through Contra's 2nd stage in the middle of a mission.

ZMR is an interesting F2P Third-Person Shooter where the gameplay is a mirror of Gears of War, down to the executions and active reloading, but the variety of game modes make things really interesting.  One mode is pretty much the Zombie survival stuff from the Call of Duty series, while others play like classic Arcade-style shooters where you're advancing through a place stage-by-stage and end with a big boss battle.   PvP is also varied with its game modes, though it doesn't seem to be played as often as the PvE side of things.

If you don't mind the annoying cash shop practices (temporary guns, long grinds to get a few permanent ones unless you're lucky with RNG, etc.) then this is a pretty fun shooter that takes elements from a lot of different games and throws them all together into one package.

Also wtf random Contra Stage 2.
