reviewText:
Not complete ♥♥♥♥, and I can completely look past the F2P limitations, as there's a certain set of expectations one walks into when you know a game is F2P, but the one absolutely unforgivable (and honestly utterly ridiculous) problem with the game is the inability to rebind 75% of your keybinds.

It's like the devs were TRYING to make a game that no one will want to play.

Super grindy time wasting?  Check!

♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ controls that can't be rebound?  Check!

Purposely misleading methods of getting people to burn through consumbales to try to get them to buy stuff?  Check!

Utterly RIDICULOUS pricing model (seriously, $60 for a half dozen weapons, and a couple of costumes? Are you joking?  That's worth $10 TOPS)?  Check!

Outside of the control issue though, the game is actually pretty decent (especially so for being F2P).  It's just too bad that they managed to ♥♥♥♥ up a fundamental cardinal rule that basically precludes anyone actually playing it.

Until they add proper FULL key rebinding, this game is garbage.

I don't honestly expect them to pull their heads out of their ♥♥♥ with the pricing, but the key rebinding should have been sorted out before this ever hit steam.

Unbelievable.

reviewText:
Pros:
-Its free
-The gameplay is basically the same as playing gears of war
-Not necessary pay 2 win since you can grab the weapon the other player was carrying when he died in pvp, so you have a chance against those with better gear than yours, same with co-op PVE every enemy drops the weapon they were carrying.
-Competitive PVP and Co-op PVE both with different modes makes the gameplay less repetitive.

Cons:
-Like any other free 2 play game, it has in-game currency and real life currency, with the first one being really hard to farm since you get soo little in every match, either pvp or pve the amount of gold you get is very low, even with gold boosts.

-The game has an in-game store were you can buy cosmetics (t-shirt, glvoes, hats) and weapons, but you dont buy them permantly, you can, but its waaaay too expensive and limited to a few amount of items, so you end up using the rent gear" system the store has

reviewText:
A blast to play with challenging maps to overcome while making new friends. Joining corps to topple down difficult modes such as nightmare. And in the down time, I pvp and relax honing my shills. Chatting with others about upcoming updates and guns to come while planning new ways to take on maps easier and smoother. More to come in time and hopes this game grows as well.

reviewText:
Two things: Limited time items that can't be found and bought respawns.
What I mean by limited time items are not the type that are awesome and bought for a certain time period; it is the type that you get an item and you can only use it for like 5 minutes. Pathetic that they even try to use that.
Bought respawns...this reminds me of GunZ 2 in this way and the last. You have to buy some respawns that cost real money so you can progress on Co-Op missions that you worked hard on only to get auto-kicked if you don't respawn after you die.
Really? Is this considered a super good shooter? These two things are total buzzkills for me. It claims to be super fun and addictive, but the two pts. that I mentioned totally lowers the bar for total play time and fun while playing it. Call of Duty, which is good for a dead game in my eyes, has this right every time and leaves players addicted and free of being so flinchy because you won't be kicked if you die in Co-Op and you can respawn as much as you want.
Since you buy both, I guess it's just one of their schemes to gain money becuase you're tempted to respawn and keep items. It's a weak way on buying money. If you don't have the game yet, don't fall for this little scheme of getting you desperate so they can squeeze you down to a pulp on money. Don't fall for how they make you think that you can spend a lot of time trying to get something because it's a useless attempt. Now I'm going to play a game worth my time.

reviewText: Although I am quiet new to the game I love this game very much. This is perhaps the best F2P FPS game out there that I have played. The graphics are godlike when turned max and the game runs smoothly. The reloading mechanics is my favorite part. It makes reloading more realistic and even people in real life can make mistakes when in stress. The game's animation and character mode are good. Characters creation is creative and does not lock stuff like female characters. The animation in game looks realistic. Your character will stutter when bombarded, will duck or nearly fall down when enemies fire at you. The smoke and explosions are amazing to watch. Missions have well designed cut scenes and quests have good variety of AI. This game also have PVE PVP so the playability is increased by alot. Weapons and everything is pretty much obtainable F2P and most weapons are balanced. Items are given out when you level or do mission which is great if you want to try out new weapons before buying them from the store. This game is very nice and I have been spamming my friends to get them to play with me. Been playing like non stop when I started this game.

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this game for a number of reasons. Some people will have an issue with the leasing on weapons and items (it's just a way to keep you playing, though) and the cash shop, but the biggest issue is actually the gameplay.

The gameplay is like a weird, janky version of Gears of War. It does not play or handle smoothly. You will probably get killed trying to take cover or get away from cover just because the controls are iffy and the game's responsiveness is even more questionable.

Fun concept, poor delivery. But it *is* free, so you can try it out without risking anything but a little bandwith.

reviewText:
Zombies Monsters Robots is a free Thirst Person Shooter. It has Jiggle Physics. 300/10.

But in all seriousness, it has the nostalgic Gears of War gameplay, but with ridiculous enemies. There's a lot of comic humour too. All I've played so far was the Co-op PvE, ad all I can say is, it's fun, addicting, but the only downside is that I get connection issues at times. (Lag Spikes)

I'd say, this game is one of those rare, GOOD F2P games, and I really reccommend it.

reviewText:
When I first started playing I really enjoyed the game, the PvE was really enjoyable and was different from what I expected - a lot of the PvE content feels like actual raids and gives a sense of reward for beating the final boss.
The PvP is like a buggy verison of Gears of War mixed with Call of Duty - make note that this it not a compliment, but I enjoyed it regardless to a certain extent.

Pros:
-Free
-A good variety of guns and weapon mods
-PvE is fun and challenging

Cons:
-Freemium, pay to win, pay to play, it's not even nickel and diming you. A good gun LITERALLY costs over $10.00 USD.
-The PvP rewards a passive playstyle of sitting and waiting for someone to walk by so you can down them in half a second = not fun, not challenging, not skill-oriented.
-Headshots seem to be rewarded randomly throughout the game, I've shot someone in the chest and been awarded headshots multiple times.
-If people spend money on this game, they WILL outperform you, always. The paid for equipment puts them miles ahead of the f2p players
-Buggy, unpolished (ex. wall bouncing glitches all the time)
-Renting system
-F2P players are heavily disadvantaged, so much so PvP is a joke

reviewText: The game's concept is spectacular, facing off against different kinds of zombies, different kinds of monsters AND different kinds of robots giving the possibility for thousands even millions of possible enemy types and then having to fight all of them at the same time. On top of it all you can choose from tons of different weapons and customizations to make your zombie hunting, monster slaying, robot destroying adventure even more epic. The only problem with this game is... that none of that is actually there.\n\nWhen I first watched the trailer for this game the above was exactly what I thought, I was expecting some sort of wave survival game were you were pitted against all these different and unique enemies with your own unique weapons and loadout, but after I played my first game my opinion quickly changed. There is only one PvE mode where all" enemies can appear and you fight them and it's a wave survival but it feels more like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ tower defense mode and with "all" the enemies appearing I saw maybe at most 30-40 different enemy types
date: and as far as I saw there were no "monsters" aside from maybe these weird flying things that didnt do anything. For a game called "Zombies Monsters Robots" it was seriously lacking in terms of the "Monsters" and thats only in comparison to the other two. If it's compared to a game that actually has a decent amount of enemies then even the zombies and robots are seriously lacking.\n\nWhat I was expecting for enemies was a mix of Left 4 Dead

reviewText:
The Screenshots and Videos of this game? Show great promise until you are struck by the nasiest and worst pay-to-win/pay-to-play tatics in the book (Hence their E3 reward by Cursefire, now you understand why). The first game I would compare this to is Combat Arms though Nexon is more lenient on their game as they have similar elements.

Customization Options & Content:
You receive 2 timed weapons after completing tutorial and I suspect most equipment will be rented or overpriced.
I know this is a fairly new game, but it by far is very limited and pushing players to rent things or buy overpriced equipment is very unacceptable of En Masse. The fact you find the first equipment you earn to also be rented!

Gameplay & Graphics:
Now lets go onwards the game. I seriously thought the graphics would have been good, the level design is as anything you seen before; dull. Gameplay was one of my main reasons I just couldn't feel I could play this; For example sometimes you will never suceed as the mobs can overflow you and T-Rex Boss match. (Good luck with that)
The mob spawns are unreasonable and cheap. I also have been kicked out twice along with few matches being very laggy. Movement will make your gameplay feel bad along with aiming.

Controls
I should have never picked up a Sniper rifle in the first place because its not easy to use because of this game's already had to understand & chunky controls (Aiming is not easy). In the tutorial I could not understand how to even follow instructions with such idiotic controls they given along with their restricted movement on the character. For a Third-Person shooter I expect the most from this category then any other part, because of the different view it has from a First-Person shooter. I also find that getting out and going into cover is the hardest thing to do.

Respawn tokens also cost money if you need more with horrible enemy AIs, bad customization systems, horrible controls, and not as promising as what it looked like. I'm just not sure if I want to play ZMR ever again if it reminds me of Combat Arms and other Pay-to-win games.
Now I can't do a full accessment of the game because I have not played it for a fair amount, but ZMR is just full of advertisement and promises that you won't actually get to see.

reviewText:
It looks fun, and it had alot of content to it. The gameplay though, is the most boring and lackluster experience there is. Progression is slow and unsatisfying, and rendered pointless due to pay2win tactics.

General:
All guns feel the same, with the exception being shotguns and sniper rifles totally useless.
All player characters pant loudly while sprinting, constantly

PVP:
Laggy.
Pay2Win buisness model.

PVE:
All of the enemies are bullet sponges.
Many enemies and enemy attacks blind you by exploding into smoke or just literally covering your screen with something.
Human enemies heads like to absorb into their ribcage when you shoot at them, denying headshots.
If you take out 99% of an enemies health and then have to reload, and someone else fires 1 single bullet to kill the enemy, they get the credit and points, while you don't.
No experience, gold, or otherwise is awarded unless you complete the entire mission to the very end, and if you run out of respawn tokens (3 per round or buy more) then you are auto kicked, denying you any kind of progress in the game.

Overall: Sucks

reviewText:
It looks fun, and it had alot of content to it. The gameplay though, is the most boring and lackluster experience there is. Progression is slow and unsatisfying, and rendered pointless due to pay2win tactics.

General:
All guns feel the same, with the exception being shotguns and sniper rifles totally useless.
All player characters pant loudly while sprinting, constantly

PVP:
Laggy.
Pay2Win buisness model.

PVE:
All of the enemies are bullet sponges.
Many enemies and enemy attacks blind you by exploding into smoke or just literally covering your screen with something.
Human enemies heads like to absorb into their ribcage when you shoot at them, denying headshots.
If you take out 99% of an enemies health and then have to reload, and someone else fires 1 single bullet to kill the enemy, they get the credit and points, while you don't.
No experience, gold, or otherwise is awarded unless you complete the entire mission to the very end, and if you run out of respawn tokens (3 per round or buy more) then you are auto kicked, denying you any kind of progress in the game.

Overall: Sucks

Awful.

The game pushes DLC relentlessly.

reviewText:
The game looks fun at first, however after the constant grinds, the RNG of bullets, the insane cost of weapons and rentals leaves one completely drained and turned off from this game.  After clocking in nearly 200 hours into this game I feel that my judgment is more credible then some who simply put in a few hours.


The Cost Of Weapons in Gold -  Simply WAY too much!  Most weapons that are desrable are around 270k-300k+ which can take an incredibly long period to obtain through running any of the missions that you're given.  Even on the double or triple gold days it feels depleted because you don't necessary obtain gold on every mission run that you do.

Because of this you are left with pedestrian weapons to use, unless you got lucky with the RNG Bullets or the 3-7 day Weapon of the week, which could either be something nice, or one of the least useful weapons available, however those are rentals, not permanents.

Now if you got a steady flow of Gold that could be obtained with consistency through out every mission then this could be remidied somewhat however that isn't even the case either.

The cost for Stock weapons should seriously be around 50k to 100k A the MOST only, not triple to quadruple that amount, because in the End they are the most basic weapons and are for the most part, almost useless in the Expert/Nightmare Modes.

If they at least cost only as much as what they are really worth in-game for missions then more people would still be playing.  However Lack of accessibility unless you got luck or Grind at the beginning completely detracts many from wanting to continue.


Rep Cost - I wanted that Thresher so badly...however I basically gave up, because although I had around 14k of rep, I was nearly 6k away.  Completely ridiculous, especially when I was told that, that Modified was only okay and not even that good.


RNG Bullets - Sitting there grinding for Golds or Plats etc to try and hopefully obtain one good weapon (stock even!) really detracts away from this game.  In fact almost the entire game of progression in ZMR is completely and utterly tied to RNG.  You could spend 3-5 bullets, get lucky and obtain a phenomenal weapon, or you could blow through 50-100 bullets and get nothing good out of it.

It's basically like playing the lottery and hoping" you can win.  Not only is RNG horrible with the bullets but also with the Loot Boxes as well.  I've seen players spend over $100 and obtain nothing but garbage modifiers
date: 7-day garbage items and turrets.\n\nI've even heard stories from other fellow members on ZMR who tried to obtain the full Sentinel set and had to throw in nearly $500 for it.  $500?!?!?!  It's complete nonsense
recommended:
especially when those who said obtaining the Sent set on average for the majority who tried it cost them around $250.


Duplicate Weapons -  Seriously
hoursPlayed: how can you NOT fix this already?  If one cannot use Two of the Same Weapon then why in the world would you STILL allow duplicate weapons to occur with Bullets etc?  I had purchased the M4 (which took forever btw) through gold
voteText: however upon spending my Bullets I ended up obtaining another M4
helpfulPercent: and 5 more weapons that I already HAD in my inventory.\n\nThe RNG should have duplicates removed unless it is another *Modified* version of the weapon.  So if I had my Stock M4 but somehow got a Modified M4 that does bonus damage to Zombies or whatever then that's different.  However Two M4s
votesHelpful: Two AKs
votesTotal: 3 of the same stock snipers?  Definitely a problem that could've easily been rectified.\n\nStock Weapons Costing nearly $20 -  This is complete Thievery by EnMasse.  The fact that they would even do such a thing makes sick to my stomach.  Because of the cost
votesFunny: if one were to spend $100
commentsCount: they would in fact only obtain 5 Stock weapons of choice.  Not even a Modified incarnation
column16: but Stock counterparts.\n\nThese Weapons are nearly Useless for Expert to Nightmare Modes because enemies have an insane amount of HP
column17: so having Modified Weapons is a MUST.  The cost of Stock should Equal to what they are in usefulness in Game.\n\nLevel Limitations on Weapons - Still don't understand this

reviewText:
Its just fun. Period. If people would stop trying to pick apart every last line of data on weapons that you can get here or there, in a silly attempt to prove P2W, then there might actually be some enjoyment to be had with this gem.

Truth with P2W is this: You're all leeches. You're a waste of space in the gaming community. Nobody cares if you're a teenage twit with no money and want everything spoon fed to you. People that make these games deserve to make money. What they Do Not deserve OR need is the atypical ♥♥♥♥♥ ranter crying about a game he has to invest a few bucks in to be 'competitive' with everyone else that does.
To make it clear; replace every instance of 'P2W' with 'limited free trial' and gtfo with all the 'gimme' crap. I hope dev's finally get tired of all the baby whiners and kill off free to play gaming all together, get us back to the days of paying for what you get, instead of uneducated internet children trying to justify ->robbery<- against the wonderful programmers that decided our enjoyment was a way of life for them.

Free to play... if you enjoy the game good. If you feel you need to pay to enjoy and have a problem paying into a game, then leave. Simple as that. You're not wanted anywhere in gaming. You don't contribute in any way.

ZMR is great for a lot of hours, community isn't bad, lot of people that aren't 'pro' yet. Expert level can be done just fine by free gamers, nightmare you will want to have a Lot of hours invested (or lucky hits on bullets) or drop $20 and make it easier, up to you. It's primarily a PVE game but the PVP is good fun too. You get to kill a T-REX while he launches rockets at your face and hammers you with a gatt. And its got zambies. 11/10

reviewText: I know it says I don't have many hours in the game but I was also in Alpha and Beta before it was on Steam.  For what it is, this is not a bad game.   But it fails to be innovative enough to last. The cash shop is obismal at best and the maps are way too small.  However it is well optomized and not many bugs and for that I will give them credit.  I will not be playing this game because I'm not much into wave based gameplay.  Had this been either much larger maps I might have played a little longer but still would have lost interest.  I would love to see these developers make an MMO with the same game mechanics. Take Secret World setting, add these shooting mechanics, add a decently diverse class system and there you might have a game. I'll throw it a thumbs up just for the kudos at it being a solid game with little bugs.  But as I stated, will not be playing it.

reviewText:
I have played ZMR roughly 50-60 hours since it was released in closed beta, and I have got to say I do like the game. There are alot of things in game most of us western gamer frown upon though. Like rented weapons, cash shop only upgrades, and alot of other stuff that is most acceptable in Asian free to play games. Overall though I like ZMR, it gets alot of stuff right, It plays like Gear of War, probably because it is made by Yingpei games, formerly Epic Games China. In the game there are a variety of game modes, both pve and pvp, the pve parts of the game have you fighting various types of badguys, the aforementioned zombies monsters and robots, in a variety of game modes including objective and horde survival styled game modes. Pvp on the otherhand has all the modes you would come to expect and more, including a neat mode where you fight as the zombies monsters or robots against another team of zombies monsters or robots!


I have got to say Zombies Monsters Robots is worth a try even if you go in expecting the worst from the game, it has its moments and would really shine if the cash shop was reworked to please western gamers more, considering its western release by En Masse, I have high hopes for the long term of the game.

reviewText:
Currently, this game plays worse than Call of Duty Ghosts did upon release. There is stuttering, lag spikes, and repeated instances of glitching through, over, and into objects during any mission.  Until the lag is fixed, this game is nearly unplayabale.

That being said, the game IS fun.  If you enjoy Call of Duty zombies, Horde modes from other games, etc, then you will like this game. All games have their launch issues, and once they are resolved i will update this review again, most likely to the positive side.

I would just wait for a few days, maybe a week, then try this game out.  It isnt bad by any means, but it is laggy at the moment.

reviewText: Always love anything with zombies. I did not like how glitchy the game play was. when you run, you teleport all over the place, This makes aiming and running to a target harder. I would recommend this game once they get smooth movement during game play.

reviewText: This game at the moment is absolute trash. It's gears with a new coat of paint and it's not fun. Animation is stiff, characters mouths don't move, carbon copy of gears, etc etc. If you like playing the same game of gears 24/7 play this game. Also this game has a horrible amount of lag that is possibly the worst i've seen on launch day. Don't download this game. If you did, I highly recommend uninstalling.
